required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Blood Pressure Measurements Between Transdermal Optical Imaging and Standard of Care
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Blood Pressure Measurements Between Transdermal Optical Imaging and Standard of Care

collaborator.agency: The Affiliated Hospital of Hangzhou Normal University
The Affiliated Nanjing Drum Tower Hospital of Nanjing University Medical School

brief_summary.textblock: Participants (patients and volunteers) will be recruited to have their blood pressure measured by standard blood pressure assessment methods while having their face video recorded. The data collected will help improve the blood pressure measurement accuracy of Transdermal Optical Imaging, which relies on machine learning to extract physiological information from videos recorded.

detailed_description.textblock:
There are many ways to measure blood pressure (monitors, mercury sphygmomanometer, aneroid devices), with most relying on a cuff-inflation. Transdermal Optical Imaging measures blood pressure using a video captured by any conventional camera (e.g., those on a phone, tablet, laptop) and advanced machine learning algorithms.
The current study aims to improve the accuracy of Transdermal Optical Imaging algorithms for measuring blood pressure. The investigators will recruit participants (patients with medical problems and healthy volunteers) to have their blood pressure measured in various ways (e.g.,by registered nurses with sphygmomanometer and stethoscope, continuous blood pressure monitor, etc.). Further, participants will have their faces video-recorded intermittently between standard measurements or at the same time as standard measures.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Single visit; up to one day
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of Transdermal Optical Imaging data and Standard assessment data

arm_group.description: Blood pressure measurements by standard assessment methods and Transdermal Optical Imaging
Blood pressure measurements by standard assessment methods and Transdermal Optical Imaging

intervention.description: Blood pressure measurements completed by standard assessment methods and Transdermal Optical Imaging

study_pop.textblock: Only individuals, of any sex, over the age of 13 will be included in the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Able and willing to provide written informed consent to participate (including by parent or legal guardian if under 16 years old).
Exclusion Criteria:
- No exclusion criteria

facility.name: The Affiliated Hospital of Hangzhou Normal University

patient_data.ipd_description: No IPD will be shared with other researchers outside the team of researchers involved in the current study. Findings of the study based on group results will be shared in publications.
